subject: Technology
title: Instagram and the Photo Sharing Era
description: A fast breakdown of Instagram and the Photo Sharing Era for builders.

hook.text: Instagram launched in October 2010. It gained 25,000 users on its first day.

buildup.text: The app did one thing: let you take a photo, apply a filter, and share it. That was the entire product.

discovery.text: Filters made ordinary photos look artistic. Suddenly everyone felt like a photographer.

twist.text: Facebook bought Instagram for $1 billion when it had just 13 employees. People called it insane.

climax.text: Instagram now has over 2 billion users and reshaped how people eat, travel, and present themselves.

punchline.text: A photo filter app changed how the world sees itself.

quiz.question: How much did Facebook pay for Instagram?
